title: Scabarites

properties.name: description
properties.value: Scabarites refer to any of the "Minions of Scabaras," the scarab-headed Menaphite god of the solitude and tranquility. They are fairly strong monsters that can hit rather hard. As they generally share the same dungeon area and have various combat styles, it can be fairly difficult to fight them, even with protection prayers. To receive them as a slayer assignment, players must have done most of the Contact! quest.[1]

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Scabarites
 This article has a Slayer task guide here.
Information comparing locations for Slayer tasks will be on this page

Scabarites refer to any of the "Minions of Scabaras," the scarab-headed Menaphite god of the solitude and tranquility. They are fairly strong monsters that can hit rather hard. As they generally share the same dungeon area and have various combat styles, it can be fairly difficult to fight them, even with protection prayers. To receive them as a slayer assignment, players must have done most of the Contact! quest.[1]

When given "Minions of Scabaras" as a Slayer task, only Scarab swarms, Locust riders, and Scarab mages will count. They are generally assigned to slayer tasks in fairly low numbers (Nieve assigns between 30 and 80). Scarab swarms are not recommended as they are accurate, hit hard, and are a random spawn chance.

Scabarites include:

  • Scarabs
  • Scarab swarms
  • Locust riders
  • Scarab mages
  • Giant scarab

Habitats[edit | edit source]

  • The Sophanem Dungeon, which is featured in the Contact! quest.
  • The Ruins of Ullek, which is featured in the Beneath Cursed Sands quest.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 26 March 2016. (Archived from the original on 30 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "Scabarites: Most of the Contact quest."

'''Scabarites''' refer to any of the "Minions of [[Scabaras]]," the scarab-headed [[Menaphite Pantheon|Menaphite]] [[god]] of the solitude and tranquility. They are fairly strong monsters that can hit rather hard. As they generally share the same dungeon area and have various combat styles, it can be fairly difficult to fight them, even with [[protection prayers]]. To receive them as a slayer assignment, players must have done most of the [[Contact!]] quest.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/jagexash/status/713721069136449537|date=26 March 2016|archiveurl=https://archive.is/3HSja|archivedate=30 May 2020|quote=Scabarites: Most of the Contact quest.}} 

When given "Minions of Scabaras" as a [[Slayer task]], only [[Scarab swarm]]s, [[Locust rider]]s, and [[Scarab mage]]s will count. They are generally assigned to slayer tasks in fairly low numbers ([[Nieve]] assigns between 30 and 80). Scarab swarms are not recommended as they are accurate, hit hard, and are a random spawn chance.

Scabarites include:
*[[Scarabs]]
*[[Scarab swarm]]s
*[[Locust rider]]s
*[[Scarab mage]]s
*[[Giant scarab]]

==Habitats==
*The [[Sophanem Dungeon]], which is featured in the [[Contact!]] quest.
*The [[Ruins of Ullek]], which is featured in the [[Beneath Cursed Sands]] quest.
